thread.title: How would you vote if a second EU referendum was held today - here's your chance
thread.title_full: How would you vote if a second EU referendum was held today - here's your chance

author: Mike Kelly
title: How would you vote if a second EU referendum was held today - here's your chance

organizations.name: european union leave the european union

text:
The Union Jack pictured next to the European Union flag (Photo: Yui Mok/PA Wire) Share Get daily   Could   
The North East famously backed Brexit on June 23. 
But now just over five months later, if given the chance, would it do so again? 
Today we give you that chance. We have set up a poll giving you the chance to cast your vote a second time. poll loading Do you think the United Kingdom should remain in the European Union or leave the European Union? 0+ VOTES SO FAR Remain in the European Union Leave the European Union 
The earliest indication that the Leave campaign was to triumph that historic night came in the North East. 
First when the Remain campaign just scraped home in Newcastle where they had expected a resounding victory. 
And then Sunderland where Leave was this time expected to scrape home but ended up winning by a landslide. A 'Vote LEAVE' battle bus (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) 
Across the North East, there was a 58% vote for Brexit , despite it being the heartland of the Labour party whose policy was to remain in the EU. 
It seems ironic that now the EU referendum has passed, the British people are much more informed about what impact it will have. 
Before the vote, then Prime Minister David Cameron and former Chancellor George Osborne predicted economic Armageddon should the UK vote to leave the EU . 
There were predictions of stock market collapse, that the value of sterling would tumble and Nissan would be one of a slew of firms which would pack their bags and leave the UK. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
